reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Chab Dai- assisting victims of human trafficking

description.narrative: Cambodia is a country of both origin and transit for human trafficking. The relations and trust between the police and communities has historically been weak and not serving the best interest of victims. The project builds the capacity of duty bearers (pol ice and authorities, government and other stakeholders) in providing protection and access to justice to the child victims of human trafficking and abuse. A training curriculum will be designed based on a study of the authorities? knowledge and skills rega rding child rights. Training material will be made to address the real needs of the authorities working directly with victims and their families. The training will cover the psycho-social aspects of the work with child victims, as well as appropriate legal procedures and law. Project will also facilitate trainings on Child Rights in communities, including local police and authorities in order to build better relations and trust between the police and communities. The expected results of the project are impr oved understanding and strengthened practices of child rights, children are protected better from exploitation and victims and their families are protected and have access to justice. A connected network will be formed to facilitate a timely and coordinate d child victim care and child protection. Direct beneficiaries are 60 local Police in Prey Veng and Svay Rieng, 210 local community people, community and church leaders. Final beneficiaries are children who are in danger of exploitation and human trafficki ng. The implementing partner is Chab Dai Coalition.
